newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Thursday, issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
The central bank does not post volumes.

Traders said the rates wavered in a narrow rangge in slow trading today on the first day of trading after the National Day holiday. Early-maturing one-day and seven-day contracts were relatively active.

"Some short-term financial centres (money brokerages run by the central bank) were major net borrowers today due to active trading on the domestic A share markets in both Shanghai and Shenzhen," one trader said.
Traders said there was a market rumour today saying the central bank would cut bank reserve ratios this month. Officials declined to comment. - Shanghai newsroom (86-21) 6279-7004
